subject: SAPH
title: Pro-Seminar
info: History, foundational frameworks, and key research domains for social and administrative pharmacy through examining landmark literature. Students think critically, reflect on important works, and create a cognitive map of the discipline and their own focus for study.

subject: SAPH
title: Pharmacoepidemiology
info: Application of epidemiologic principles to study/use. Beneficial/adverse outcomes of drugs in human populations.

subject: SAPH
title: Pharmaceutical Care Clinic
info: Students help patients achieve treatment goals and identify, resolve, and prevent drug therapy problems.

subject: SAPH
title: Adv Stud Pharm Care Pr
info: Analyzing practice/implementation of pharmaceutical care. Students confront their assumptions about pharmacy profession, pharmacy practice, and pharmaceutical care. Discussions, guest speakers, intensive literature searches/evaluation.

subject: SAPH
title: Seminar
info: Contemporary issues and research problems in sociobehavioral pharmacy, pharmacoeconomics and policy, and clinical research.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Implementing Res
info: Integrates scientific, statistical, and practical aspects of research. Interrelationships among design, sample selections, subject access, human subjects requirements, instrument selection and evaluation, data management, analyses plans, grant writing, and research career issues. Field experiences.

subject: SAPH
title: Research Problems
info: Individually designed research experience directed at contemporary problems related to drug use process.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Clin Ther
info: Lectures and readings in topics in clinical pharmacology that illustrate the continuum of a thorough understanding of the pathophysiology of a disease state, its contemporary treatment, problems or controversial issues with current treatment approaches, and strategies to advance therapy.

subject: SAPH
title: Exper Clin Pcol
info: Theory of advanced methodologies, applications, and evaluation techniques used to determine efficacy and toxicity of new drug therapies. Advanced techniques for collecting and evaluating data.

subject: SAPH
title: Phar Econ & Pol
info: Economic analysis of pharmaceutical sector of health care systems. Problems of pricing production and distribution of pharmaceuticals. Domestic or international policy issues relevant to price and access of pharmaceuticals.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Pharmaceutical Marketing
info: Historical development of distributive systems, marketing channels, institutions, policies, and practices as they relate to pharmaceutical industry. Contemporary issues/theory related to pharmaceutical marketing. Pharmaceutical proportion, especially directed to consumer advertising.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SACP major or  instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Clin Conferences
info: N/A
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Clinical Clerkship
info: Supervised study of pharmaceutical services at Fairview-University Medical Center or affiliated institutions.

subject: SAPH
title: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: SAPH
title: Pharmacomet
info: Theory and application of contemporary methods for analysis of concentration-time data and exposure-response relationships.

subject: SAPH
title: Soc Behav Aspects
info: Historical development of the profession, its growth and development, emphasizing forces of education, professionalization, attitude modification, and changes occurring as a product of legal and organizational forces in society.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: FTE: Doctoral
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: SAPH
title: Phar and Environ
info: Cultural foundations of pharmacy. Development of present state of pharmacy practice. Role of pharmacist as health practitioner in relation to other health practitioners. Identification of factors (health policy, regulation, economics, research and development, promotion) that affect individual responses to drug therapy.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Phar & Environ
info: Cultural foundations of pharmacy. Development of present state of pharmacy practice. Role of pharmacist as health practitioner in relation to other health practitioners. Identification of factors (health policy, regulation, economics, research and development, promotion) that affect individual responses to drug therapy.

subject: SAPH
title: Pharmacoepidemiology
info: Pharmacoepidemiology is the study of the uses and effects of drugs in patient populations. The science of pharmacoepidemiology borrows from pharmacology and epidemiology. This course will introduce students to the field of pharmacoepidemiology including study methodology,  relevant statistics, data sources, measurement of treatments and outcomes, sources of bias and control of confounding, techniques to reduce bias and confounding, survival analysis and regression techniques, interpretation of results, and drug safety surveillance and risk management.

subject: SAPH
title: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr*
info: Doctoral pre-thesis credits.
prereqInfo: prereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: SAPH
title: Hosp Phar Admin
info: History, classification, organization, and functions of hospital departments in relation to the pharmacy service.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Hosp Phar Survey
info: Readings for self-directed students to explore contemporary issues in hospital pharmacy practices.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]

subject: SAPH
title: Soc Psy Hlth Care
info: Behavioral and social aspects of recovery responses to drugs and other therapies, patients' compliance with prescribed therapies, relationships between healthcare professional and patient.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad SAPh major or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Social Measurement
info: How social factors such as innovativeness, compliance, religiosity, and stress are measured and tested for reliability and validity. Relationships between theory, concepts, variables, data.
prereqInfo: prereq: Intro stat course, understanding of simple correlations or instr consent

subject: SAPH
title: Thesis Credit:Doct*
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 24 cr required
